multipleChoice.name: Multiple Choice
multipleChoice.description: Choose the best answer from given options

passages.title: University Campus Tour
passages.text: Welcome to our university campus. The main library is located in the center of campus, next to the student union building. The library is open from 8 AM to 10 PM on weekdays, and 9 AM to 6 PM on weekends. There are over 500,000 books and 50 study rooms available. The cafeteria is open from 7 AM to 8 PM daily, and the gym facilities are available from 6 AM to 11 PM on weekdays and 8 AM to 10 PM on weekends.

questions.question: What time does the library close on weekdays?
How many books are available in the library?
What time does the cafeteria close?
When is the gym open on weekends?

sentenceCompletion.name: Sentence Completion
sentenceCompletion.description: Complete sentences with words from the audio

passages.title: Weather Forecast
passages.text: Today will be sunny with a high temperature of 25 degrees Celsius. There is a 20% chance of rain in the afternoon. The wind will be light, around 10 kilometers per hour. Tomorrow will be cloudy with temperatures reaching 18 degrees Celsius and a 60% chance of rain.

questions.question: The high temperature today will be _____ degrees Celsius.
There is a _____ percent chance of rain today.
The wind speed will be _____ kilometers per hour.
Tomorrow's temperature will reach _____ degrees Celsius.

shortAnswer.name: Short Answer Questions
shortAnswer.description: Answer questions briefly using words from the audio

passages.title: Travel Information
passages.text: The train to London departs from platform 3 at 2:30 PM. The journey takes approximately 2 hours and 15 minutes. The ticket price is 45 pounds for adults and 25 pounds for children.

questions.question: What platform does the train depart from?
How much does an adult ticket cost?

multipleChoice.name: Multiple Choice
multipleChoice.description: Choose the best answer from given options

passages.title: Honeybees
passages.passage: The honeybee is a remarkable insect known for its role in pollination and for producing honey and beeswax. Honeybees live in well-organized colonies and communicate with each other through a unique dance language. Their work is essential for the growth of many crops and wild plants. These social insects have a complex hierarchy with a queen, workers, and drones, each playing specific roles in the colony's survival.

questions.text: What is one important role of the honeybee?
options: They live alone in the wild.

questions.text: How do honeybees communicate with each other?

passages.title: Solar Energy
passages.passage: Solar energy is one of the most abundant and clean sources of renewable energy available on Earth. The sun provides enough energy in one hour to meet the world's energy needs for an entire year. Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity through a process called the photovoltaic effect. This technology has become increasingly affordable and efficient over the past few decades.

questions.text: How much energy does the sun provide in one hour?
What process converts sunlight into electricity?

trueFalse.name: True / False / Not Given
trueFalse.description: Determine if statements are true, false, or not mentioned

passages.title: Climate Change
passages.passage: Climate change is affecting global weather patterns. Scientists have observed increased temperatures worldwide, leading to more extreme weather events. Some regions are experiencing longer droughts, while others face increased rainfall and flooding. The melting of polar ice caps is contributing to rising sea levels, which threatens coastal communities around the world. Research indicates that human activities, particularly the burning of fossil fuels, are the primary drivers of these changes.

questions.text: Global temperatures have increased in recent years.
All regions are experiencing drought conditions.
Scientists use satellites to monitor climate change.

yesNo.name: Yes / No / Not Given
yesNo.description: Answer yes, no, or not given based on the passage

passages.title: Electric Vehicles
passages.passage: Electric vehicles are becoming increasingly popular as people seek more environmentally friendly transportation options. These vehicles produce zero emissions during operation and can be charged using renewable energy sources. Many governments are offering incentives to encourage the adoption of electric vehicles.

questions.text: Do electric vehicles produce emissions during operation?
Are governments providing incentives for electric vehicles?
Are all electric vehicles more expensive than gasoline cars?

sentenceCompletion.name: Sentence Completion
sentenceCompletion.description: Complete sentences with words from the passage

passages.title: Human Brain
passages.passage: The human brain contains approximately 86 billion neurons. These neurons communicate through electrical and chemical signals. The brain is responsible for all our thoughts, emotions, and actions. It continues to develop throughout our lives.

questions.text: Complete the sentence: The human brain contains about _____ billion neurons.
Neurons communicate through _____ and chemical signals.

diagramLabeling.name: Diagram Labeling
diagramLabeling.description: Label parts of a diagram using information from the text

passages.title: Water Cycle
passages.passage: The water cycle consists of four main stages: evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and collection. Water evaporates from oceans and lakes, condenses into clouds, falls as rain or snow, and collects back into water bodies.

shortAnswer.name: Short Answer Questions
shortAnswer.description: Answer questions briefly using words from the passage

passages.title: Internet History
passages.passage: The Internet was developed in the 1960s as a military project called ARPANET. It was designed to allow computers to communicate even if some connections were destroyed. Today, the Internet connects billions of people worldwide.

questions.text: What was the original name of the Internet?
When was the Internet first developed?

part1.name: Part 1: Introduction & Interview
questions: What do you do in your free time?
What kind of music do you like?
What do you do for work or study?

part2.name: Part 2: Individual Long Turn
part2.description: Speak for 2 minutes on a given topic
questions: Describe a place you would like to visit
Talk about a book you have read recently
Describe a person who has influenced you
Talk about an important event in your life

part3.name: Part 3: Two-Way Discussion
questions: What are the advantages and disadvantages of living in a big city?
How has technology changed the way people communicate?
Do you think education should be free for everyone?
What are the benefits of learning a foreign language?
How important is it to protect the environment?

task1.name: Task 1: Letter Writing
task1.description: Write a letter based on a given situation
prompts: You recently stayed at a hotel and had a problem with your room. Write a letter to the hotel manager explaining what happened and what you would like them to do about it.
You are planning to move to a new city and need to find accommodation. Write a letter to a local real estate agent asking for information about available apartments.
You have been invited to a friend's wedding but cannot attend. Write a letter to your friend explaining why you cannot come and wishing them well.
You recently bought a product online but it arrived damaged. Write a letter to the customer service department requesting a replacement or refund.
You want to apply for a job in another city. Write a letter to a friend asking for help with finding accommodation and information about the area.

task2.name: Task 2: Essay
task2.description: Write an essay on a given topic
prompts: Some people believe that technology has made life easier and more convenient, while others think it has made life more complex and stressful. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
Many people believe that the best way to learn a foreign language is to live in the country where it is spoken. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
Some people think that the government should spend money on public services rather than on the arts. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
In many countries, people are living longer. What are the advantages and disadvantages of this trend?
Some people believe that children should be taught to be competitive, while others think they should be taught to cooperate. Discuss both views and give your opinion.

studyPlanQuestions: Have you taken an IELTS test before? (Yes/No)
What was your last IELTS score?
What is your estimated current score?
What is your target band score?
generalQuestions: What is the IELTS test format?
How can I improve my listening skills?
What are the best strategies for the reading test?
How can I prepare for the speaking test?
What should I focus on for the writing test?
